alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:24PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston, Tangipahoa and southwestern Washington Parishes through 515 PM CDT... At 424 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Folsom, or 12 miles northeast of Hammond, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Amite, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Independence, Roseland, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Enon, Natalbany, Robert and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 31 and 63. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 25 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington
